Events that occurred on 30 March

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1936 - C.A. Furth (of George Allen & Unwin Ltd) writes a letter to J.R.R. Tolkien.
1940 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 38.
1953 - J.R.R. Tolkien and Edith move to 76 Sandfield Road.
1968 – The documentary Tolkien in Oxford is aired on the BBC.
1972 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 334.
2005 - Unsung Heroes of The Lord of the Rings is published.
2023 - The Battle of Maldon: together with The Homecoming of Beorhtnoth is published in the UK.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3019:
Frodo and Sam, rescued out of the fire, rest in Ithilien.
First Quarter of the Moon[1]
